channel.title: DLF AIG Metadata Application Profile Clearinghouse
channel.description: A Collection of Application Profiles for Digital Collections

image.title: DLF AIG Metadata Application Profile Clearinghouse

item.title: Free mapping: Metadata Best Practices for the Illinois Digital Heritage Hub
item.description:
This document was created for institutions (libraries, archives, and museums) that contribute digital collections metadata to the IDHH, covering best practices for each metadata field used by the Digital Public Library of America (DPLA), based on DPLAâ€™s Metadata Application Profile.
Author: undefined | Section: Illinois Digital Heritage Hub
Lang: EN | Pages: undefined | Year: 2017
item.dc:creator: DLF AIG Metadata Interest Group

item.title: Free mapping: South Carolina Digital Library Metadata Schema & Guidelines
item.description:
The element descriptions presented here represent the Dublin Core fields for the item-level records created and maintained for the South Carolina Digital Library.
Author: undefined | Section: South Carolina Digital Library
Lang: EN | Pages: undefined | Year: 2016
item.dc:creator: DLF AIG Metadata Interest Group

item.title: Free mapping: DPLA Partners Crosswalk, Map 4.0
item.description:
DPLA Mapping Crosswalk to QDC, DC, MODS, MARC, Primo, and others.
Author: undefined | Section: Digital Public Library of America
Lang: EN | Pages: undefined | Year: 2017
item.dc:creator: DLF AIG Metadata Interest Group

item.title: Free mapping: DPLA Ruby Ingestion System Mappings
item.description:
A ZIP archive containing samples of the mappings created for DPLA's Ruby-based ingestion system (no longer in use), called KriKri (the DPLA-specific implementation was called Heidrun). See README inside for details.
Author: undefined | Section: Digital Public Library of America
Lang: NA | Pages: undefined | Year: 2017
item.dc:creator: DLF AIG Metadata Interest Group

item.title: Free mapping: DPLA Python Ingestion System Mappings
item.description:
A ZIP archive contains a collection of Python documents, including mappings, enrichments, other scripts, and a profile used in the system to pull in mappings and enrichments. See README inside for details.
Author: undefined | Section: Digital Public Library of America
Lang: NA | Pages: undefined | Year: 2017
item.dc:creator: DLF AIG Metadata Interest Group

item.title: Free mapping: Bayou City DAMS MAP
item.description:
This website presents the University of Houston's metadata application profile for digital collections. The Bayou City DAMS MAP extends the DPLA MAP for local needs and provides an API for workflow applications.
Author: undefined | Section: University of Houston Libraries
Lang: EN | Pages: undefined | Year: 2017
item.dc:creator: DLF AIG Metadata Interest Group

item.title: Free mapping: DPLA Metadata Application Profile
item.description:
The DPLA Metadata Application Profile is designed to build on the experience of the Europeana Data Model. In addition, it incorporates feedback from the DPLA community and digital hub pilot participants to create a balanced framework that allows us to accommodate existing and emerging data models for library, archive, and museum resources.
Author: undefined | Section: Digital Public Library of America
Lang: EN | Pages: undefined | Year: 2015
item.dc:creator: DLF AIG Metadata Interest Group

item.title: Free mapping: Mountain West Digital Library Dublin CoreÂ Application Profile
item.description:
Created by the Mountain West Digital Library (MWDL) Metadata Working Group in 2009, this profile superseded the Metadata Guidelines for the Mountain West Digital Library (2006).Â Â It is intended to guide the creation of new metadata (i.e., created after June 1, 2010) by members and contributing partners of the MWDL.
Author: undefined | Section: Mountain West Digital Library
Lang: EN | Pages: undefined | Year: 2011
item.dc:creator: DLF AIG Metadata Interest Group

item.title: Free mapping: Rice University Electronic Thesis and Dissertations MAP
item.description:
This document presents existing metadata elements used for the description and long-term stewardship of Riceâ€™s electronic theses and dissertations. This profile is based on recommendations from the Networked Digital Library of Theses and Dissertations' metadata standards for ETDs and the Texas Digital Library's ETD MODS application profile.
Author: undefined | Section: Fondren Library, Rice University
Lang: EN | Pages: undefined | Year: 2014
item.dc:creator: DLF AIG Metadata Interest Group
